intro: Sinodielsia yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan sinodielsia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and compact, shrub-like growth habit. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
